content.description: Featured face climbing 70 ft. to anchors. Crux is from 1st bolt to 2nd.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Up in Smoke is the first bolt line directly to the right of Lost in Space (which is the leftmost).

content.description: Moderate slab, a little runout between bolts 2-3 and 3-4. Good holds throughout. Felt similar in difficulty to Easy Rider, maybe slightly easier.
content.location: Bolted line in between Easy Rider and Are You Small?

content.description: Starts below the headwall, passes it on the left end, then up to the 100 ft anchors.
content.protection:
4 bolts, the slab above the headwall is very low angle.

2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Teenage Wasteland is the first bolt line on the headwall routes (left to right) or the 6th bolt line on the Elvis slab.

content.description: Just left of Left Book climb to the top of a pillar to a (2 bolt belay?). Climb the featured face to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Straight Outta Memphis is to the right on the headwall routes and left of the "Left Book".

content.description: This is the second route from the right on the left-side slab of Squarenail, left of the large flake.  Start next to (left of) Graceland and climb past six (?) bolts, and crimp and balance your way over the thin, vertical bulge then cruise to the anchors shared with Graceland.
content.protection: 6 draws (maybe more) plus 2 for the chains

content.description: Moderate climbing up to anchors 100 ft up.
content.protection:
7 bolts

2 bolt anchor with Quick Links
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Reefer Madness is the 4th bolt line from the left (Lost in Space).

content.description: Similar climbing to Up in Smoke.
content.protection:
4 bolts

2 bolt shared anchor with Up in Smoke.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Purple Haze is the 3rd bolt line from the left.

content.description: This is the classic right face corning at Squarenail.
content.protection: Thin to 1", 2 bolt anchor with rap chains.
content.location: Start at the base of the long corner, Between "Are you Small" & "Zig Zag".

content.description: Climbs the most difficult holds through the headwall. Can top rope at the lower chain anchor or continue to the one at 85 ft shared with Blue Suede Shoes & Soul Kitchen.
content.protection:
4 bolts. First bolt ~ 20ft up on mid angle slab.

Both the lower and 85' bolt anchors are OLD but still are usable.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Lounge Lizard is the 8th bolt line from the far left of the Elvis slab, or directly left of Soul Kitchen.

content.description:
Elvis Wall

Leftmost climb up a water polished streak to anchors 85 ft. up.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Because of the moderate ratings and accessibility, Elvis is the most popular area to climb at Square Nail Rock.

content.description: Low angle grainy slab leads to two bolt anchor. Same anchors as Easy Rider, Unknown, & Are you small.
content.location: A large block separates the Elvis Wall from the rest of Squarenail. This is the left side of the block.

content.description: On the left side slab of Squarenail, this is the furthest right sport route that reaches the base of the slab.  It starts about 15 feet left of the large flake (that has anchors above it), and climbs over the short vertical bulge in the wall, then up and slightly left to the anchors.

Mixed route of slab. I only did the first pitch, cant speak for the second besides that it looked like some good hard slab and tops out on playground ledge. First pitch is fun and even though the first bolt is high there is gear below it
content.location: First route right of the zig zag flake. One level lower than the first level you come to on the approach trail

content.description: From the top of the Straight Outta Memphis pillar follow moderate face just a few feet right of Straight Outta Memphis to a shared anchor.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Elvis Has Left the Building is the furthest right slab climb on the Elvis Wall. Direct to the right is "Left Book" as depicted in Southern Sierra Rock Climbing guide book.

content.description: Moderate slab. Lower slab a little grainy.
content.location: 1st bolt line to the right of "Left book"

content.description: Moderate climbing past a small roof to same anchor as Reefer Madness. This & Graceland are the easiest route at the Elvis Wall.
content.protection:
7 bolts

2 bolt anchor shared with Reefer Madness.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder. Dazed and Confused is the 5th bolt line from the left or last line before the headwall section of the Elvis Wall.

content.description: Climbs straight up through the headwall to anchors 85 ft. up. Access to top rope Lounge Lizard.
content.protection:
4 bolts, the slab above the headwall is very low angle.

2 bolt OLD anchor with chains.
content.location: Elvis Wall is the orange and brown textured face below the Aid Boulder.

content.description: "The arÃªte" at Squarenail. This is a super fun line with lots of exposure over the corner down to Mr. Wizard.
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchors. Can access anchors for toprope from Left Book. Best for the belayer to sling a boulder to anchor in if the climber slips off prior to 1st bolt.
content.location: Scramble down the broken ledge to the right of "Left Book". There is a belay spot wide enough for the belayer.
